intro: Hieracium tincticuspis, commonly known as the purple-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive purplish tinge, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium tincticuspis is often found in temperate regions and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
